intro: Erythrina huehuetenangensis, commonly known as the Mexican coral tree, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers. The plant has compound leaves with three leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of soil types. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for landscaping in warm climates.
